snippet: Oil-industry lobbyists are trying to undermine transparency measures in America and Europe that could help prevent future tyrants, like the Libyan dictator Muammar el-Qaddafi, from emerging.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Najwa al-Beshti, former official at Libya's state-owned National Oil Corporation, appeals to the Securities and Exchange Commission to finalize a proposal that would force American and foreign companies to disclose how much they pay governments for access to their oil, natural gas and minerals; contends the rule is essential if Libya is to rid its oil industry of corruption.
lead_paragraph: Oil-industry lobbyists are trying to undermine transparency measures in America and Europe that could help prevent future tyrants, like the Libyan dictator Muammar el-Qaddafi, from emerging.
